remarks: Alternative definition of being a linearly dependent subset of a (left) vector space.  In this case, the reverse implication of ~ islindeps2 holds, so that both definitions are equivalent (see theorem 1.6 in [Roman] p. 46 and the note in [Roman] p. 112: if a nontrivial linear combination of elements (where not all of the coefficients are 0) in an R-vector space is 0, then and only then each of the elements is a linear combination of the others.  (Contributed by AV, 30-Apr-2019.)  (Proof shortened by AV, 30-Jul-2019.)
